derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin solaris, from sol 'sun'
Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French soler, from Latin solarium 'gallery, terrace'

entry.def: Solar is used to describe things relating to the sun.

example.ex: A total solar eclipse is due to take place some time tomorrow.

entry.def: Solar power is obtained from the sun's light and heat.

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or derived from the sun or utilizing the energies of the sun;

Sentence.sentence: Premier Gardens is one of a half-dozen subdivisions in California where every home cuts power consumption by 50%, mostly by using low-power appliances and solar panels.
But inside, special windows cut power bills by blocking solar heat in summer and retaining indoor warmth in winter
The rest of the energy savings comes from the solar units.
They will serve as modem Magellans, mapping out the solar system for whatever explorers follow, whether man or machine.

But while much of the research and innovation has concentrated on finding less-polluting energy alternatives, it may be decades before clean technologies like wind and solar meet a significant portion of our energy needs.

jushi.english: There was a solar eclipse last month.
